result.execSummary:
The defendant Rochea L Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Washington County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall have no contact with Phyllis Sammis or her residence.
Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

timeConds.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Court authorizes transfer of jail to Milwaukee County or jail convenient to employment or residence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rochea L Anderson

records.addlTxt: Washington County Sheriff's Department Jail Disposition of Prisoners
Washington County Sheriff's Department Jail Disposition of Prisoners

Def in person & by Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Previously adjourned for sentencing; joint recommendation placed on record with Defense free to argue on jail sentence.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Sentencing hearing on April 15, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Def in person & by Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Def was not able to pay restitution, adjourned sentencing date requested; State moves to amend to Misd theft by fraud contrary to Wis Stat 943.20(1)(d); Court has concerns re: proposed amendment;  Partial joint recommendation: 9 mos jail w/ Huber I/S for 12 mos probation, $243 cc, $500 restitution + 10%, 30 days condition time (free to argue condition time); Statements from State, Counsel; On motion of the State, Court amends the charge to Misd theft contrary to Wis Stat 943.20(1)(d); No contest plea entered to Ct. 1 as amended; Colloquy w/ def; Court accepts no contest plea, finds def guilty on Ct. 1 as amended; Sentencing adjourned. Bail remains as is.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Per request of Atty. Katherine Romanowich, 3-04-15 Hearing rescheduled to 3-18-15 at 9:45 a.m.

Def in person & by Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Resolution anticipated involving an amendment.   Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Victim does not request to be present for hearings

Def in person & by Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Counsel's first appearance.  Complaint is incorrect per defense; Defendant's name is Rochelle; Court orally amends complaint to reflect correct name for Defendant as:  Rochelle Anderson with no middle initial.  DA will file amended complaint with alias.   Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 09:45 am.
No contact with victim PS or residence

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romonawich State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Jeanette Kara Corbett for State.   Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  State requests sig bond/no contact; Statements from defense; Court sets $2500 sig bond;  SPD will represent the defendant;  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for December 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.
